body.name: SZD I8 Micro ATX PC Gaming Case, Mini-ITX Motherboard Small Form Factor Computer Chassis with Tempered Glass Side Panel, Front I/O USB 3.0 Type - C Port, High Airflow MESH Panels (White)
body.stockDetail: Only 5 left in stock - order soon.
features: Small Portable PC Case: Compatible with Micro ATX and Mini-ITX Motherboards. Crafted from SPCC steel, providing excellent durability and resistance to damage during transport and handling. The addition of an aluminum handle on the top makes it easy to carry and transport.
Front I/O USB 3.0 Type-C Port: Stay connected and enjoy fast data transfer with the convenient front USB 3.0 Type-C port. Easily connect your gaming peripherals and other USB devices.

Support ATX/SFX Power Supply: This case is compatible with 140mm ATX power supplies and includes a power conversion bracket for SFX power supplies. The height limit of the CPU fan is 135mm, allowing for efficient cooling even in a compact space.
MESH Panels: With four vented honeycomb/meshed panels,, this case effectively improves the performance of hot and cold air exchange. Keep your components cool and enhance overall system performance.

Compatible with ≤ 335mm Graphics Cards: The case can accommodate graphics cards up to 335mm in length, with a height limit of 70mm and width of 140mm, offering compatibility with a wide range of high-performance graphics cards. Enjoy smooth and immersive gaming visuals.
body.description: I8 White Small Size, Big Features Portable Micro ATX / Mini-ITX PC gaming case;Small aluminum handle for easy portability ;Front I/O USB 3.0 Type-C port;Space-saving efficiency and strong cooling capabilities;Transparent side panels to showcase the beauty of your components;Four PCI slots for maximum compatibility with up to 335mm long full-size GPUs;Four vented honeycomb/meshed panels for optimal airflow; Support MATX/ITX motherboards High-Airflow Mesh Panel Incredible Face Value Type-C Ready Free-Tool Disassembly

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.0 4.0 out of 5 stars 26 ratings 4.0 out of 5 stars

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: SZD Portable MATX PC Gaming Case - Front I/O USB 3.0 & Type-C Port, Tempered Glass Side Panel, Easy to Carry The SZD I8 Micro ATX Gaming PC Case is a sleek and compact computer chassis designed for small form factor builds. This case offers space-saving efficiency and cooling capabilities usually found in much larger ATX cases. Its white color adds a touch of elegance, making it a standout addition to any gaming setup. With its small size, the I8 can easily be displayed on your table, becoming a main decorative element of your gaming system.

ABOUT SZD SZD brand is founded by like-minded users in computer users group, providing computer integrated solution for users. We are proud of the quality and quality of every computer we build for gamers. Starting with each build, we need to consider the budget, manually select each component, and test performance, compatibility, value, and aesthetics. Every game you dominate, every level you break, every game you win, we want to be part of every step of the way. I8 White Small Size, Big Features Portable Micro ATX / Mini-ITX PC gaming case;Small aluminum handle for easy portability ;Front I/O USB 3.0 Type-C port;Space-saving efficiency and strong cooling capabilities;Transparent side panels to showcase the beauty of your components;Four PCI slots for maximum compatibility with up to 335mm long full-size GPUs;Four vented honeycomb/meshed panels for optimal airflow; Support MATX/ITX motherboards High-Airflow Mesh Panel Incredible Face Value Type-C Ready Free-Tool Disassembly

Compact and Portable With dimensions of 13.7 x 6.22 x 10.63 inches and a volume of 14.8L, this I8 case is highly portable, making it ideal for LAN parties or gaming on the go. Versatile Compatibility The I8 can support different motherboard sizes, Compatible with both ITX (170x170mm) and MATX (244x244mm) motherboards. Transparent Side Panel The side panels of the I8 are made of transparent Tempered Glass, allowing you to showcase your components and admire the beauty of your build. Three Dust Filters Four dust filters mesh for keeping and protecting your computer and electronics parts clean, no need screws, easy and convenient installation.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: For the price this is a wonderful case. Cable management is hard and you gotta be sure to mount your CPU backplate before you put it in the case because the back does not come off. It is tiny but everything fits just fine, including a full ATX PSU.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars good size travel pc
reviews.reviewText: Ordered this for a re-case of an old PC. I just gotta say everything did fit, it's just tight. I'd recommend this case for a APU or a small Graphics card build. Make sure you have a modular and smaller PSU. The only issue i had with this case was one of the legs's screw holes wasn't done correctly. So my case has three legs. You also have to drill through the mesh to get the parts to go where they belong. Overall it's a good value. Works as intended. Love being able to carry the case with the handle.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Small yet practical
reviews.reviewText: Just so people are aware, the marketing visual illustrations are not the best for part fitment. It will in fact fit an matx board and an atx psu in a sub 15L case with decent gpu clearance. I'd recommend a fully modular 140mm psu with short cables if you run ATX, and depending on how your cables route, the GPU can be closer to 290mm without hitting anything. I feel like this is really the sweet spot for SFF builds with matx boards. It really maximizes possibilities without being too expensive, yet easily small enough to put some ITX cases to shame. There is still plenty of room for different GPU sizes as well. I plan on doing more with the case and eventually will go crazier, but this was a cheap case I wanted to try with old PC parts and I'm really pleased with how it turned out.If I were to improve on the design, in my opinion the motherboard is mounted a tad too high. You could easily drop it a few millimeters to create more gpu clearance from the psu cables, and it would likely help with making even 120 fans fit up top rather easily. This would lead to the other problem of the power cable location. It's really just in the way of potential fan mounting as well. It could easily be moved down about an inch and still be just above the rear exhaust fan. This would clear any space needed at the top of the case. Lastly, I thought the feet on this case were a bit ugly. Functionally they add more height for air to act as intake, but I really just thought they were too high.I would definitely recommend this case to those who want to downsize some without going all out ITX SFF. It's not the most challenging case to build in at all. There is no removable back panel on this case, so just make sure you run cables you want to hide behind the MB, and just plan accordingly for the parts you have.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Hard to work with, needs extras
reviews.reviewText: First, the only pro : it's very small for a micro atx case, and light weight.Cons - very cramped work area.-no hiding cables in a clear side case-dust filters aren't correct sizes, don't have magnets, don't have cut outs for feet, or handle.-vent holes have poor spacing for poor airflow, add the dust filters and it chokes.-no rubber on tg holes, so screws could crack or shatter your glass if you aren't very careful on install-on tg panel, nowhere for it to sit while mounting or opening side panel.Case overall feels super cheap for just being a box with a panel. Really unfortunate but maybe a dollar in components and design changes and this could've been a great case. Still if you're creative and don't mind some hard work it is a small enclosure with a handle for matx

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great budget sff case.
reviews.reviewText: The case is no frills. Simple but well built. The rear panel does not come off so make sure your CPU cooler is assembled and fitted before you put in the motherboard. Also the rear fan is 92mm depending on you gpu thickness you can put 2 120mm fans on the bottom of the case but the top won't because the power passthrough for the power supply goes right over the top. ASRock steel legen 6650xt, gigabyte rx7600, and a EVGA 3070 ti all fit while using a sfx power supply. I gave it 4 stars because of the top fans and no rear panel access.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing Design, Good Aesthetic, construction material could be better.
reviews.reviewText: It is incredible value at 70 dollars that I can fit a FULL microatx motherboard and sfx psu in this 14.8L case. Aesthetic is good, not sure how else you could do cable management hiding in a case this tightly packed. Pretty much perfect, my only complaint would be if they could use some type of higher quality heavier metal to make it feel more premium and durable?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Needs a rethink
reviews.reviewText: The case looks fine and seems to be well-built. The problem is in the details of the design choices. I'll cover the 3 that I encountered before I made up my mind to return the case, but you may see others if you get further than I did. First thing I noticed was no rubber gaskets around the glass side panel. This means the glass will be sandwiched between two pieces of metal. Overtightening the screws could easily lead to broken glass. Second red flag I encountered was that the mobo standoffs are welded to the back panel, meaning you can't reposition them. This resulted in one of the standoffs touching the edge of my mobo, which just feels like a short waiting to happen. The last strike was that the PSU bracket just simply won't fit an ATX power supply, and there appears to be no method for attaching said PSU without it. I didn't even get around to installing a hard drive, but the instructions make it look like we're just suppose to stack them like books below the PSU? How is that suppose to work?It's a shame because the case looks good and is a unique size w/ unique features (the handle, for example). If they were better about the details of the actual build, it would be a home run. Alas...I'm returning and will keep shopping.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Be mindful of the size of your atx psu
reviews.reviewText: I really like the case and the only negative I can see is that cable management is awful. I was not able to reuse my old psu because it was too big. I simply assumed that all atx psu were the same size. My bad for not checking so I just ordered a new psu. Overall I love the purchase and have no regrets for picking this over the other smaller cases because of the price difference. I originally wanted a C24 mechanic master but this is half the price.
